title: impl Iterator fails for user defined type with IndexMut impl
body:
I tried this code: ```rust use std::ops::{Index, IndexMut}; pub struct A { pub a: [u8; 10], } impl A { pub fn iter<'a>(&'a self) -> AIter<'a> { self.into_iter() } pub fn iter_mut<'a>(&'a mut self) -> AIterMut<'a> { self.into_iter() } pub fn len(&self) -> usize { self.a.len() } } impl Index for A { type Output = u8; fn index(&self, id: usize) -> &Self::Output { &self.a[id] } } impl IndexMut for A { fn index_mut(&mut self, id: usize) -> &mut Self::Output { &mut self.a[id] } } pub struct AIter<'a> { id: usize, a: &'a A, } pub struct AIterMut<'a> { id: usize, a: &'a mut A, } impl<'a> Iterator for AIter<'a> { type Item = &'a u8; fn next(&mut self) -> Option { let end = self.a.len(); let id = self.id; if id < end { self.id += 1; Some(&self.a[id]) } else { None } } } impl<'a> Iterator for AIterMut<'a> { type Item = &'a mut u8; fn next(&mut self) -> Option { let end = self.a.len(); let id = self.id; if id < end { self.id += 1; Some(&mut self.a[id]) } else { None } } } impl<'a> IntoIterator for &'a A { type Item = &'a u8; type IntoIter = AIter<'a>; fn into_iter(self) -> Self::IntoIter { Self::IntoIter { id: 0, a: self } } } impl<'a> IntoIterator for &'a mut A { type Item = &'a mut u8; type IntoIter = AIterMut<'a>; fn into_iter(self) -> Self::IntoIter { Self::IntoIter { id: 0, a: self } } } #[cfg(test)] mod tests { use super::*; #[test] fn it_works() { let mut a = A { a: [0u8; 10] }; for &b in a.iter() { assert_eq!(b, 0); } for &mut b in a.iter_mut() { assert_eq!(b, 0); } } } ``` I expected to see this happen: Build successful Instead, this happened: ``` error: lifetime may not live long enough --> src/lib.rs:68:13 | 60 | impl<'a> Iterator for AIterMut<'a> { | -- lifetime `'a` defined here ... 63 | fn next(&mut self) -> Option { | - let's call the lifetime of this reference `'1` ... 68 | Some(&mut self.a[id]) | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ associated function was supposed to return data with lifetime `'a` but it is returning data with lifetime `'1` ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.69.0 (84c898d65 2023-04-16) binary: rustc commit-hash: 84c898d65adf2f39a5a98507f1fe0ce10a2b8dbc commit-date: 2023-04-16 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.69.0 LLVM version: 15.0.7 ```

Why does the similar code for the immutable iterator work (finds the implicit lifetime correctly), but the mutable version fails lifetime resolution?
